welcome.text: Hello, I'm Atlas. I'm your personal interface to the decentralized web. Let's get you set up in just a moment.

userTypePrompt.text: First, tell me how you'd like to use Atlas. Are you here as an end user exploring apps, or as a developer building on the platform?

faceSetup.text: I can appear in different visual styles. Choose a face that suits you, from minimal dots to flowing particles. You can always change this later in settings.

weather.text: These cards are auto-materialized from public endpoints. No app store, no downloads—just live data rendered directly onto your canvas.

crypto.text: Real-time prices, no frontend code required. Any developer can register an endpoint, and Atlas renders it as a tile you can pin or dismiss.

chat.text: You can talk to me directly, or choose which AI engine powers my responses. Your preferences are stored locally, encrypted by your wallet.

receipts.text: Every action you take emits a receipt—cryptographically signed proof of what happened. These receipts are yours to keep, share, or anchor on-chain.

wrapup.text: Atlas isn't an app. I'm your substrate—a composable layer that connects you to decentralized services while you stay in control of your data.

hubApps.text: The Hub is where apps live. Register your endpoints with a JSON schema, and Atlas auto-generates UI tiles. No frontend code needed.

devkit.text: DevKit lets you query the registry, inspect flows, and debug execution in real-time. Everything is observable and receipt-backed.

infrastructure.text: Under the hood: session bridging, wallet-scoped memory, and a rule engine that maps natural language to flows. Build once, run everywhere Atlas runs.

wrapup.text: You're ready to build. Check the docs, register your first endpoint, and watch Atlas render it live. Welcome to the protocol layer.
